title: Designing Large-Scale Virtual Classroom Learning Content Conversion Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in Fundamental Digital Learning Tools and Basic Social Studies Knowledge
context.additional_context: Development of a systematic learning design framework via the Fuzzy Delphi method, aiming to efficiently transition large-scale virtual education. Includes alignment with Taylor’s Curriculum Framework (TCF) and strategies to enhance learner engagement

learning_goals: Learners can systematically prioritize virtual classroom content design by applying the fuzzy Delphi method.
Learners can develop content conversion strategies suitable for large-scale virtual learning environments through project-based assessment.
Learners can design effective blended learning modules in social studies using digital tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
